page.title: 07FARMING IN EAST HADDON
page.content: East Haddon has a number of small farms.These are all very different in nature. Most keep cattle and sheep the former being divided between dairy and beef. There is therefore a considerable amount of land given to permanent or semi permanent grassland. Arable land is used either for winter grain production or root crops such as potatoes. The chicken farm on Ravensthorpe Rd is engaged inthe rearing of imported day old chicks. Birds are then taken away by lorry. Several of the farms have a small hobby collection of animals. This is due to the influence of the rare breeds collection at nearby Holdenby House. It is therefore common to see Jacob's sheep in fields together with donkeys.
